The coupled horizontal pole creaks round, and the jups lift over, tip out their silver waterfalls and dive apain into the narrow darkness of the well-shaft. The sand is hardly marked by decades of treadinp. The last thousand of the years these wells have splashed and squeaked in a daily sun-hammered quest are a snippet of their time; the miles of camel-track coil back intact. 4^ on-\u2014?'I'L >ther climates waist-hiph round walls mark out a preen dark where the buckets drop to a splash, hollow and distant; manhandled upwards they plint with cold lipht, jewelled behind the parapets. \n￼These places centred once the speech of parishes. They hunp on their flat-topped stones, in the cold morninp, the slow evening, encounters, ratherinps of chatter, round the windlass rroaninp over and over at the lift of water. .- i-lyb Q HI- 2>\\'l Sometimes a hedpe-bank leans over a plassy block of liquid held at a slow tremble- \u2014 ------ \u2014 down amonp bundles of ferns or set in a blackberry tangle, brim-full and squared by flat preen stones. $ So clear as to be nearly not there, the water touched has the shock of ice, breaking shards of brightness out of the deepest hollow dark. Purity clutched from a ditch. The eternal surprise, Q IV 1112- They are all, of a kind, shrines. Carved with the titles of saints, or decked in any case with wreaths at festivals, or round and tensioned like hubs, each of them sipnals a way to the rleam in the darkness r Vi' \n￼f\\They all reach down to something other than water; they find a way to the vital, waiting above the fissured ground, above the inaccessible, intent on the slow flow of meaning, the resolving, plitterin/^
